title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 April 2014 - XWiki
content:
<Kebir> has quit  
04:15 <Kebir> has joined #xwiki  
06:02 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:04 <Denis> has quit  
06:21 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:24 <Denis1> has quit  
06:55 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
07:40 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:40 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
08:04 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:28 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:40 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <vmassol> has quit  
09:18 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <Kebir> has quit  
09:26 <Kebir> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <spu7nic> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <spu7nic> Greetings :)  
09:47 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <DarkKnightCZ> what is the proper way of getting all objects of class in component? (i don't need the documents, only attributes of that class)  
10:11 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <DarkKnightCZ> is there .searchDocuments() equivalent for java component?  
10:25 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: searchDocument is java :) but we recommend using the query manager  
10:26 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: context.getWiki() has only search method, so injecting QueryManager is better?  
10:26 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <vmassol> I dn't understand  
10:27 <vmassol> what do you want to do?  
10:28 <vmassol> maybe http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Component+Module would help  
10:28 <vmassol> (I thought you want to search documents from Java but apparently not)  
10:28 <vmassol> \*wanted  
10:29 <vmassol> you don't search for java components, you get them or have them injected  
10:29 <DarkKnightCZ> well, i need to run piece of code on every user with specific class... so i thought of getting all documents with that class (LDAPProfileClass), checking it against XWikiUsers  and then executing this code  
10:30 <spu7nic> has quit  
10:30 <DarkKnightCZ> since there are thousands of users, i need to do it asynchronously (periodical job), but parsing fullName from executed query and creating documenterefence from that seems like bad practice :)  
10:31 <vmassol> what is bad practice?  
10:31 <vmassol> I still don't understand what's your question!  
10:32 <DarkKnightCZ> how do i get documents with hql inside component  
10:32 <vmassol> first you should use XWQL  
10:32 <vmassol> much simpler  
10:32 <vmassol> then you shoudl use hte query manager  
10:33 <vmassol> get it injected  
10:33 <vmassol> and use it  
10:33 <vmassol> (Note: I'm not commetning on whether what you're doing is good or bad, I don't know about that)  
10:34 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: here's an example: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-ircbot/xwiki-platform-ircbot-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/ircbot/internal/wiki/DefaultWikiIRCModel.java#L161-161  
10:34 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, thanks  
10:46 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <cjd> vmassol: I have a script which can reliably reproduce "Batch update returned unexpected row count from update" if this is interesting to you...  
11:36 <vmassol> well you should add it to a jira issue  
11:36 <vmassol> (if it's a bug)  
11:36 <cjd> yeah, I'm looking for one which makes sense  
11:37 <cjd> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-235 <-- kewl, I'll reopen this one since I now have a way to reproduce :)  
11:42 <cjd> actually I'm going to open a new issue  
11:42 <vmassol> yes  
11:42 <vmassol> better  
11:42 <vmassol> (you could then link them)  
11:45 <cjd> oh boy, there's more to this  
11:54 <cjd> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10272  
11:55 <cjd> This is very likely the same issue which is causing the bot to complain when we talk too much  
12:00 <vmassol> I'd love that we fix this one (the bot issue) :)  
12:00 <cjd> sorry for posting a troll issue ;)  
12:01 <cjd> The store is a mess...  
12:02 <cjd> I was asked to test concurrent uploads of fs attachments w/ clustering... now we're looking for a definition of "known good"
